III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section Staff to resident ratio
Description (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth reported they were sexually assaulted at the facility on
8/7/25 in the morning inside their bedroom. The youth reported
they consented to kissing, but nothing more. The other youth
reported the kissing was consensual. Staff policies regarding bed
checks and supervision were reviewed after the incident.
Investigation Interviews:
Director was interviewed via phone on August 11, 2025.
Director reported Youth A reported on August 8, 2025, that Youth
B sexually assaulted her on August 7, 2025, sometime around
7am. She reported this took place in Youth A’s room at the facility.
Director reported she spoke with Youth A and Youth B about this
situation, and they both confirmed this happened. She reported
Youth A stated she only wanted to kiss Youth B and not have sex.
Director reported Youth B reported the acts were all consensual.
She reported both youth reported they were in Youth A’s bedroom
for about 30-45 minutes, and no staff member did a room check.
Director reported Staff 1 is in charge of supervision at this time,
and she talked with Staff 1 about this situation. She reported Staff
1 stated when she came on shift at 7am, she sent the two other
overnight staff members’ home. Director reported there were nine
kids at the time at the facility, and their ratio during sleeping hours
is 1 staff to 10 youth and during waking hours is 1 staff to 4 youth.
She reported another staff member was scheduled at 8am.
Director reported when she spoke to Staff 1 about this situation,
Staff 1 admitted she did not physically check Youth A’s room
because she had just let her into the bathroom and thought she
was still in the bathroom. Director reported she immediately did a
review with all staff about the room check supervision policy and
correctly documenting the checks. She reported Youth B moved
from the facility on August 8, 2025.
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
12, 2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Youth A
reported she really likes the facility and feels safe here, especially
since Youth B left. She reported on August 7, 2025, she woke up
at 7am and asked Staff 1 to let her into her bathroom around
7:02am. Youth A reported she remembered she left her bedroom
door open so she could go right back in. She reported she had
gotten ready for the day and went back to her bedroom around
7:15am. When asked where Staff 1 was when Youth A got out of
the bathroom, she did not know and noted Staff 1 was not in the
hallway. Youth A reported Youth B walked into her room at the
same time she got back from her bathroom. She reported Youth B
put a shoe in between the door so it would not fully close. Youth A
reported Youth B started to kiss her and tried to take off her
clothes. She reported she told him no, and he stated he was
leaving the facility tomorrow, so today was their only chance.
Youth A reported she told Youth B she was only okay with kissing
and did not want to do any more. She reported Youth B pushed
her on the bed and penetrated her vagina with his penis, even
though she told him no. Youth A reported she remembered she
looked at her clock, and the time was 7:36am when he finished.
She reported they came up with the plan for her to go ask Staff 1
for something to distract her from noticing Youth B was in her
room. Youth A reported she went out of her room at 7:40am and
asked Staff 1 to get her hair straightener. She reported Youth B,
then snuck out of her room. Youth A reported Staff 1 never
completed a room check during that time and reported at some
point during sexual intercourse, she noticed the bedroom door
shut. She reported staff don’t always do room checks during the
day but stated the overnight staff are always checking their rooms.
Youth A reported staff during the day will only check on the youth
if they are gone for over 30 minutes. She reported she did talk
with a staff member the next day about this situation because she
felt like Youth B took advantage of her. Youth A did not remember
exactly who she spoke with. She told Law Enforcement she would
like to press charges on Youth B.
Youth B was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the
Police Station on August 28, 2025, but refused to be
interviewed. Another attempt via phone was made to contact
Youth B on September 15, 2025, by Law Enforcement and this
consultant which there was continued refusal to be
interviewed. Law Enforcement attempted to reach out to Youth
B’s Attorney though his abuse and neglect court case but never
received a response back.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
12, 2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Staff 1
reported she worked on August 7,2025 and started her day at
7am. She reported Youth B was already awake when she got
there. Staff 1 reported she told the overnight shift staff they could
go home because she could oversee the youth on her own. She
reported the next staff member scheduled was at 8am, therefore
she would only be alone for less than an hour. Staff 1 reported the
two third shift members left around 7:10am. She reported just after
they left, Youth A asked her to let her into the bathroom. Staff 1
reported a couple of minutes later, Youth B asked to be let into his
own bathroom. She reported this was when she started to do
bedroom checks but never checked Youth A’s room because she
could hear her in the bathroom. Staff 1 reported she did another
bedroom check around 7:30am but did not check in on Youth A’s
room because she thought she could still hear her in the
bathroom. She reported she did check Youth B’s room but only
saw Youth B’s roommate and suspected he was still in the
bathroom as well. Staff 1 reported she did not check the
bathrooms. She reported another youth asked her to go into the
kitchen for something. Staff 1 reported around 7:40am, Youth A
asked her to get something out of the staff office for her. She
reported bed checks should be completed in variable intervals in
less than fifteen minutes. Staff 1 reported she saw that Youth A’s
bedroom door was open. She reported she sometimes will knock
on bathroom doors when it is over fifteen minutes, but she could
hear the shower going, so she did not knock on the door. Staff 1
reported Youth A and Youth B had a close relationship and had to
be reminded to keep appropriate boundaries. She reported she
was not aware that Youth A was sexually assaulted by Youth B.
Staff 1 reported if she could change anything, she would have had
third shift staff stay till the next staff got in since all the youth were
waking up before the other staff got in to work. She reported she
would have also checked the bathrooms.
Documents Reviewed
- Facility’s Supervision Procedure- This procedure notes
that “15-mintue checks will be done with youth who are in
their bedrooms or utilizing any private or enclosed spaces
within the Bridge”. This procedure also notes, “When youth
use the restroom, staff will maintain supervision by placing
themselves in the hallway to observe when youth exit the
restroom. Staff will check bathrooms to ensure safety and
cleanliness after youth exit the restrooms.”
4

- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been working at
the facility since August 2021. There have been no
disciplinary actions noted within her HR file. Staff 1 is in
compliance of all her training. Staff 1 completed a refresher
training of documentation requirements on 07/21/2022. She
also completed a review of all the facility’s polices on
01/12/2023.
- Bed Check Log for Youth A dated August 7, 2025-
There was no bed checks completed after 6:45am.
- Incident report from August 8, 2025- These incident
reports were consistent with the disclosure from Youth A’s
interview and Director interview.
- Email from Law Enforcement dated September 16,
2025- Law Enforcement reported she is moving forward
with her criminal case without the interview of Youth B. The
case will be brought to the prosector to review. There are
no criminal charges against the facility.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as within interviews with
Youth A and Staff 1, Staff 1 never completed a room check when
Youth A was in her bedroom. It was also found Staff 1 didn’t
remain in the hallway to ensure Youth A exited the bathroom as it
notes within the supervision policy.
Technical Assistance
Consultant provided the facility technical assistance to update
their supervision procedure to be in compliance with the language
of the rule. Currently the policy notes 15- minutes checks will be
done, where the rule notes that checks should be completed in
variable intervals not to exceed 15-minutes.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section Staff to resident ratio
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility was out of ratio during waking hours on August 7,
2025.
Investigation Interviews:
Director was interviewed via phone on August 11, 2025.
Director reported on August 7, 2025, at the time the incident
occurred, there were three staff members scheduled to work with
5

nine youth at the facility. Staff 1 thought she sent the two
overnight staff home when she got into the facility at 7am. Which
meant Staff 1 was out of ratio because there were nine youth at
the facility at the time. The next staff member was not scheduled
to come in till 8am. She reported the facility’s ratio during sleeping
hours is 1 staff to 10 youth and during waking hours is 1 staff to 4
youth. Director reported the waking hours start at 7am.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
12, 2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Youth A
reported when she came out of her room on August 7, 2025, in
the morning to use the bathroom, she only saw Staff 1. She
reported when she exited her room at 7:40am after the assault,
only Staff 1 was working at that time.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
12, 2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Staff 1
reported during waking hours, the ratio for the facility is one staff
member to every four youth. She reported waking hours begin at
7am. Staff 1 reported on August 7, 2025, she told the other two
overnight staff members to go home around 7:10am, and she was
alone with all nine youth until 8:00am. She reported she normally
would have no issue since she was only alone for less than an
hour, but multiple youth were up asking her for different things that
needed her attention, so she did not provide adequate
supervision. Staff 1 reported if she could change anything, she
would never have told the third shift staff members to go home
and have them stay till 8am when the next staff member arrives at
8:00am.
Documents Reviewed
- Facility’s Supervision Procedure- This procedure notes,
“All efforts will be made to provide a 1:4 staff to youth ratio
during waking hours and 1:6 staff to youth ratio during
sleeping hours. Contact shifts may not be single staffed.”
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been working at
the facility since August 2021. There have been no
disciplinary actions noted within her HR file. Staff 1 is in
compliance of all her training. Staff 1 completed a review of
all the facility’s polices on 01/12/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of not following their ratio
policy of having 1 staff to 4 youth during waking hours. Staff 1
reported in her interview she had sent the two overnight staff
home early as she felt she could handle the supervision on her
6

own. It was found Staff 1 was alone with nine youth from 7:10am
to 8:00am on August 7, 2025.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: On August 7, 2025, a youth (Youth A) reported being sexually assaulted in her bedroom at The Bridge for Runaways by another youth (Youth B) during the early morning waking hours. The investigation substantiated that Staff 1, who was the sole staff on duty, failed to perform required 15-minute variable interval room checks, did not properly supervise the bathroom hallway as per policy, and left the facility out of ratio (1:9 instead of the required 1:4) by dismissing overnight staff early. While the assault is a criminal matter between residents, the facility and Staff 1 are culpable for the critical supervisory failures that created the unsafe environment in which the assault occurred.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violations involve a sexual assault (Youth B penetrating Youth A against her consent) that occurred due to a failure of supervision. This aligns with the 'Severe SIRs' category for 'Safety and Violence' (sexual abuse) and is directly linked to 'Restraint and seclusion' issues (failure to conduct required 15-minute variable interval checks) and 'Environmental or supervision failures' (staff being out of ratio during waking hours, leading to inadequate supervision).
